statement.title: # Content
statement.content: Given a directed weighted graph who has at least three nodes, can you find the minimal directed weighted cycle with at least three nodes?

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content:
The input contains a single test case.

In the first line there is two integer $n$ - the number of nodes in the graph, $m$ - the number of directed edges in the graph. $(0 < n \leq 100, 0 \leq m \leq n^2)$

Then $m$ lines follow, each line contains three integers $i$ $j$ $k$, which means that there is a directed edge coming from node $i$ to node $j$ with a weight of $k (0 \leq k < 2^{15})$.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: You should output a single line with a single integer presenting the weight of the cycle you have found or `-1` (without quotes) if there isn't any.
